structured_content.summary:
Case ID: C … Prevent 2
Protect does not provide direct treatment or therapy, but instead offers case management,
intensive mentoring, systems navigation, and technical assistance to promote early intervention
and reduce the threat of violence in school communities
action_items:
Specifically,
Excessive checking, Repetitive or ritualistic
actions, Scrupulosity (i

Further evaluation of
neurodivergent symptoms/ASD is needed when
developing strategies to address current
symptoms and behaviors

Further workup
may be needed should Ben continue to have
episodes of syncope or near-syncope

Parents
working together to meet Ben's needs, obtain
services in the school and medical setting will
help Ben build a sense of security through
consistency in all environments

Wants to engage with peers and desires positive peer interactions
3

Perceives himself as different from his peers, does not feel like he fits in and longs to belong
Safety Considerations
Safety Plan – Area of Concern and Recommendation
• No access to weapons
• Weapons secured properly All knives and guns should be secured when
not in supervised use
• No access to ammo
• Close parental supervision 24/7 - all environments
• Close school supervision monitor daily - backpack checks
• Monitoring social media Parental monitoring listed social media
accounts - explore video game genres
• Psychoeducation regarding risk and need
to seek emergency attention Safety plan constructed with team, see below
• Access to ES or ED Local emergency rooms/ES as indicated
• Ability and understanding when to call
911
If SI/HI develops, the patient should be
evaluated immediately, and if has active SI/HI,
intent or plan he should be taken to the
emergency department or emergency services
(if can be transported safely) if there is any
question 911 should be called immediately

Due to the nature of the participant’s risk and current needs, the
participant should NOT have access to weapons, ammo or explosive devices or other means to
harm to self or others

Should the
participant develop a change in behavior, agitation, suicidal ideation, homicidal ideation, intention,
or plan to injure self or others (or increase thereof), the parent/guardian/participant is to call 911 or
go (if safe to transport) directly to the emergency department/emergency services for emergency
evaluation
